New Records: Ryan Helsley tied the franchise record for saves with his 48th save of the season, equaling the mark set by Trevor Rosenthal in 2015.
Helsley set club records for consecutive saves (31) and saves before the All-Star break (32).
Helsley did not blow a save at Busch Stadium all season, going 27 for 27 at home.
Key Match Events: Ryan Helsley secured the Cardinals' 5-2 victory over the Rockies with a one-pitch save.
Helsley induced a 107.1 mph grounder from Colorado’s Sam Hilliard and started a double play to end the game.
Brenton Doyle hit a solo homer and Michael Toglia drew a one-out walk in the ninth inning, prompting Helsley's entry into the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Ryan Helsley expressed pride in being part of a storied franchise and being mentioned among the top number of saves in franchise history.
Helsley reflected on his desire for the Cardinals to be playoff-bound instead of eliminated from postseason contention.
Cardinals manager Oliver Marmol praised Helsley's hard work and availability throughout the season.
Pedro Pagés highlighted Helsley's consistency and dominance throughout the 2024 season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals clinched at least a .500 season with their 81st victory.
